intro: Lonicera tatarica f. alba, commonly known as white honeysuckle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caprifoliaceae family. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant produces small, red berries that are edible but not particularly flavorful. Native to eastern Asia, it is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it suitable for a variety of garden settings.
